meanings.definition: To forcibly put an end to something
meanings.sent1: The firefighters worked hard to suppress the raging fire.
meanings.sent2: The police had to suppress the riot to restore peace in the city.
meanings.sent3: The superhero used his powers to suppress the villain's evil plans.
meanings.sent4: The teacher tried to suppress the students' excitement before the surprise announcement.
meanings.sent5: The medication helped suppress the patient's coughing fits.

meanings.definition: To prevent the development, action, or expression of something
meanings.sent1: She tried to suppress her laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent2: The strict rules were put in place to suppress any cheating during the exam.
meanings.sent3: The magician used a trick to suppress the audience's ability to guess his next move.
meanings.sent4: The bad weather threatened to suppress our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent5: The noise-canceling headphones helped suppress the loud sounds from the construction site.

meanings.definition: To keep something secret or hidden
meanings.sent1: The spy had to suppress the classified information to protect national security.
meanings.sent2: She had to suppress her excitement about the surprise party to avoid spoiling the secret.
meanings.sent3: The treasure map was hidden to suppress the location of the buried gold.
meanings.sent4: The author had to suppress the identity of the main character until the end of the book.
meanings.sent5: The government tried to suppress the leaked documents to avoid public scrutiny.
